definition: to jump/to hop/to skip over/to bounce/to palpitate
to catch sight of in a doorway (old)
board/plank/plate/shutter/table tennis bat/clappers (music)/CL:塊|块[kuai4]/accented beat in Chinese music/hard/stiff/to stop smiling or look serious

sentences.english: Use your current job as a springboard to later success.
sentences.chinese: 将当前的事业作为走向下一个成功的跳板。

sentences.english: Some say the fish for fame, not long dry on the steering political springboard.
sentences.chinese: 也有人说是沽名钓誉，干不长时间就转向政治跳板。

sentences.english: Napoli is an end point and not a springboard for Cavani.
sentences.chinese: 那不勒斯将会是卡瓦尼的重点，而非跳板。

sentences.english: Too many people live too much in the past . The past must be a spring-board, not a sofa.
sentences.chinese: 太多的人，太过于迷恋过去为跳板而非沙发椅。

sentences.english: Fix rat traps on the gangplank.
Youget me up on that gangway and you rill out in front of me a keyboard ofmillions of keys, Millions and billions of keys that never end.
sentences.chinese: 走过跳板，前面的键盘有无数的琴键。

sentences.english: The diver dived into the pool from the high diving board.
sentences.chinese: 跳水运动员从高台跳板上一头扎进水池里。

sentences.english: The jumper's foot must not mark beyond the takeoff line at the far end of the board.
sentences.chinese: 运动员的脚不允许超过起跳板前沿的起跳线。

sentences.english: He was the first man dawn the gangway and into the lone telephone booth on the wharf .
sentences.chinese: 他第一个冲下跳板，跑进码头上独一无二的电话间。

sentences.english: The lieutenant appeared at the top of the gangplank , holding Gilbert in his arms.
sentences.chinese: 中尉来到了跳板上，挽着吉尔伯特的胳膊。

sentences.english: He sprang from the diving-board into the water.
At ten, I explored doing gym exercises off the diving board at the pool.
sentences.chinese: 十岁时我便在游泳池的跳板上练体操。

sentences.english: The lieutenant appeared at the top of the gangplank, holding Gilbert in his arms.
sentences.chinese: 父亲出现在跳板处，抓住吉尔伯特的手臂。

sentences.english: For CapitaLand, Shanghai was their first stepping stone into China.
sentences.chinese: 对凯德置地来说，上海是他们进入中国的跳板。

sentences.english: The recommended distance between the takeoff board and the end of the landing area is 21 meters.
sentences.chinese: 起跳板与着地面远端之间的参考距离为21米。

definition: to stand firmly/to gain a foothold/to establish oneself
lit. a brick as a door knocker (idiom); fig. a temporary expedient/to use sb as a stepping stone to fortune
the road one must follow or take/the only way/same as 必由之路[bi4 you2 zhi1 lu4]
to land/to come ashore/to make landfall (of typhoon etc)/to log in (frequently used erroneous variant of 登錄|登录[deng1 lu4])
a way out/a way to retreat/leeway
standard weight (used on a balance scale)
stumbling block/obstacle/someone who gets in your way
